comments:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Generate a new C++-Project with automatic makefile generator. 
   for example 'helloWorld'.
2. Write some code, do a build, and run the application anything should be fine.
3. do a complete close of eclipse, and restart immediately.
4. reopen the Project in question - no updated build is possible anymore, no 
   automatic updates of errors, no content updates at all.

If I check now the Properties of the Project, I get errormessages when i try to
enter the c++-Build-propertypage, or the 'errors/parser'-propertypage (sorry,
work on german languagepack, so I hope the translation fits), I get some
Errormessages saying that there is no valid content for these pages.

After this procedure, I find the following in the Debuglog:

This happens to any of my C++-Projects... :(

My System: 

Linux Kernel 2.4.213
Eclipse Version: 3.0.1 Build-ID: 200409161125 installed as simple user

There was a problem with the encoding of the XML file that was addressed and 
should be available in 2.0.3. I suspect that this is the problem the user is 
facing.

2.1 should not have this problem.
